intro: Hermione lutea, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial shade, making it a popular choice for garden landscapes. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its vibrant color and delicate appearance.
